channel.title: HTML Question?
channel.description: Ok so i recently started learning HTML, (I only used to know the very basics) and I decided to make a form for my new project im making. Now, I followed some tutorials and found out how to make the form, and I did indeed sucessfully make a form to fill out (name, username email etc.) but I dont know how to make a submit button that will send the information filled out on the form to my email. Is there any way to do this? Excuse my stupidity because im sure this is reasonably simple basic stuff for you guys. I appreciate and help I can get. Please tell me if im not clear enough I will break down my situation into smaller details if needed.

item.title: HTML Question?
item.dc:creator: @no1toldme2 no1toldme2
item.description:
@no1toldme2 wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:2, topic:400922”]i think u would need to use server-side scripting like php.

http://www.w3schools.com/php/php_mail.asp

as far as ik the only thing u can do with email from html is mailto:insertyour@emailhere.com <-- which only upens ur default email client, if u havent changed it then probably MS outlook.[/quote]
I use that too! If i dont use it i use kompozer program, KomPozer.net

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Question?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“Acrodox, post:5, topic:400922”]Would

[code]
Username:

[/code] work?[/quote]

No, use the PHP GET/POST function. Example:

$email = $_POST["email"]; 
$subject = $_POST["subject"]; 
mail($email,$subject,message,headers,parameters)
// and so on

etc, I don’t really know PHP but that’s a rough idea.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Question?
item.dc:creator: @Acrodox Acrodox
item.description:
@Acrodox wrote:

Would

[code]
Username:

[/code] work?

EDIT: Nevermind it doesnt work and im really stuck, I tried googling a tutorial but cant find one? Can anyone refer me somewere they might know that can help? Thanks TONS.

Read full topic

item.title: HTML Question?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

krackkid:

You need php.

Exactly, it doesn’t require a ton of PHP knowledge. You could just do a few Google searches and throw it all together.

Read full topic
